titles.title: Authorizing the Architect of the Capitol to transfer the catafalque to the Supreme Court for a funeral service.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

AMENDMENTS TO LEGISLATION - Mr. Moakley notified the House that Members wishing to offer amendments to the bill should submit 55 copies of proposed amendments to the Committee on Rules, room H 312, Capitol, by Noon on February 1st.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. Directs the Architect of the Capitol to transfer the catafalque in the crypt beneath the rotunda of the Capitol to the Chief Justice of the United States to be used in the Supreme Court Building for funeral services for the late Honorable Thurgood Marshall (former associate justice of the U.S. Supreme Court).
